intro: Stillingia mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
